snippet: The activist, Xu Zhiyong, was charged for his role in a grass-roots campaign that prompted street rallies across the country.
abstract: Chinese prosecutors indict rights advocate Xu Zhiyong for his role in anticorruption campaign that prompted street rallies across country and deeply alarmed Communist Party leaders; Xu faces up to five years in prison if convicted.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong. Patrick Zuo contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The activist, Xu Zhiyong, was charged for his role in a grass-roots campaign that prompted street rallies across the country.

headline.main: Rights Advocate Is Indicted in China Over Role in Campaign Against Corruption
headline.print_headline: Rights Advocate Is Indicted in China Over Role in Campaign Against Corruption

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
